After watching this movie, I couldn't help but notice the parallels between it and another film called America 3000. Both were very bad mid 1980's scifi movies that feature a girl who fantasizes about robots (like Wall-e) making her life better. In both cases she risks everything to escape into space where all of her one dimensional undesirable qualities are suddenly gone and in their place we see her become a heroine worthy of tribute in modern day pop culture.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that what was going on with them is solely related to an unseen creature from thousands of years ago.
For some people this movie was average and for others it really didn't cut too well as most of us agree that it seems just like another bad creature feature. Nothing too good with the story or anything

While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, they channel their problems over into other people's families and homes during busy party moments. Their schemes can be quite devastating but meet with satisfaction from their recent unemployment status.
This short spoofs cut development films with a female talent agency being rounded up for unemployment shots

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes that pulls you in and reminds me Strawberry Fields Forever and A Clockwork Orange. Which I think were consciously or unconsciously referenced by Todd Phillips. The aesthetics are great but also foreboding.

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an attempt to create a cult phenomenon with its blatant spoofing of martial arts films and ultimately it does just that.
